biogHist.p: Dentist, [19Ã¾]-1970. J.D. Hawkins (DDS, 1932) was an instructor in operative dentistry from 1944 to 1946 and a lecturer in oral anatomy from 1947 to 1963 in the Faculty of Dentistry. He was active in dental associations, including the Edmonton and District Dental Society, for which he served as President from 1945 to 1946. In the early 1960s the Alberta Dental Association commissioned Dr. Hawkins to update A.E. Jamieson's 1948 History of Dentistry in Alberta. He chose to expand the book by adding material on the Yukon and Northwest Territories. This collection derives from his research for the project, which he never completed.
